quantityRules.description: Corn snakes are solitary. House individually only - minimum 40 gallons for adults (36√ó18√ó18 inches).

setupTips: Provide multiple hides on both warm and cool sides
Include branches for climbing - corn snakes are semi-arboreal
Ensure secure lid with clips - corn snakes are escape artists
notes: Docile and easy to handle, excellent for beginners
Crepuscular and nocturnal - most active at dawn/dusk

warnings.message: Secure enclosure with locking lid required - corn snakes are expert escape artists
Wait 48 hours after feeding before handling to prevent regurgitation

feedingRequirements: Carnivorous - feed appropriately sized frozen-thawed mice
Prey should be no wider than the widest part of snake's body
Never feed live prey - risk of injury to snake
feedingSchedule: Hatchlings (0-12 months): Every 5-7 days, pinky to fuzzy mice
Juveniles (1-2 years): Every 7-10 days, hopper to adult mice
Adults (2+ years): Every 10-14 days, adult mice
waterNotes: Provide large water bowl for drinking and soaking
Change water every 2-3 days or when soiled
Bowl should be large enough for snake to soak entire body
mistingNotes: Mist enclosure lightly 2-3x weekly or provide humid hide
